{{also|tschuess|tschüß}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|tschüß|tschüs|tschö}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|nds-de|tschüß}} from earlier {{m|nds|adjüs}}, from {{der|de|nl|adjuus}}, back-formation from {{m|nl|adjuusjes}}, from {{der|de|fr|adieu}}. (See also {{m|de|moin}}.) ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/t͡ʃʏs/}} * {{audio|de|De-tschüss.ogg|Audio}} ===Interjection=== {{head|de|interjection}} # {{lb|de|informal}} [[bye]], [[cheers]], [[ciao]] ====Usage notes==== * ''Tschüss'' was originally common only in northern and central Germany, but it has gained wider acceptance and is now also commonly used in southern Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and {{w|South Tyrol}}. The farewell {{m|de|auf Wiedersehen}} is often considered more appropriate to use towards strangers and generally in formal situations in Southern Germany. In northern and central Germany, ''tschüss'' is a standard goodbye in all but official situations, with the north preferring the older form ''tschüß''. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Tschüss}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|cs|čus}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden|tschues}}
